content.question: A fair six-sided die will be rolled fifteen times, and the numbers that land face up will be recorded. Let <math alttext="x bar sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average of the numbers that land face up for the first five rolls, and let <math alttext="x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average of the numbers landing face up for the remaining ten rolls. The mean <math alttext="mu" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and variance <math alttext="sigma squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> of a single roll are 3.5 and 2.92, respectively. What is the standard deviation <math alttext="sigma subscript, x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2, end subscript" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> of the sampling distribution of the difference in sample means <math alttext="x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 2.92 over 5, end fraction, plus the fraction 2.92 over 10, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 2.92 squared over 5, end fraction, plus the fraction 2.92 squared over 10, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 2.92 squared over 5, end fraction, minus the fraction 2.92 squared over 10, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 2.92 over 5, end fraction, plus the fraction 2.92 over 10, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.92</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
